text:
Hurricane Laura is blamed for at least 10 deaths. The storm is estimated to have caused between $4 billion to $12 billion in damages, but experts say the price tag could have been far worse.

name: NPR
text:
BREAKING: The actor Chadwick Boseman, who starred in the "Black Panther," has died after a four-year battle with colon cancer. He was 43.

name: NPR
text: Martin Luther King III: "There's a knee upon the neck of democracy and our nation can only live so long without the oxygen of freedom... So, if you're looking for a savior, get up and find a mirror. We must become the heroes of the history we are making." https://t.co/lnYj0esKhW https://t.co/jJEFT62gfo

name: NPR
text:
When Dr. Ayim Darkeh's mom asked him what it's like being a Black doctor, he told her "there are moments where it's amazing."

"Especially when I get my older patients who are members of the civil rights generation," he said. "They're so proud of me."
https://t.co/MSBR5LEq5o

name: NPR
text:
As debates rage over how to portray Kyle Rittenhouse, extremism researchers say part of the problem is that the teen gunman falls into a hard-to-define category of gunman that's increasingly showing up at protests â€” the self-styled vigilante.
https://t.co/dr6U0SQoKc

name: NPR
text:
The Arecibo Observatory was substantially damaged this month. It's one of the largest radio telescopes in the world â€” and has been used to detect asteroids and other planets.

And that damage has big implications for slowing down research. #NPRShortWave https://t.co/46HpJyRsQf
